Ontology Description: A material entity that has the specimen role.

Description: Identifier for this specimen’s parent specimen (optional)
Ontology Description: A material entity that has the specimen role.

Description: A count of specimens derived from this specimen (cumulative)
Ontology Description: A measurement datum that is the output of counting.

Description: Type of specimen (excised tissue block, slice, cell, etc.)
Ontology Description: A textual entity that denotes the type of a specimen.

Description: Hemisphere that this specimen came from (left, right, both, unknown)
Ontology Description: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's spatial location relative to other objects in the vicinity.

Description: Specimens location within anatomical structures from brain atlas
Ontology Description: A morphology quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's relative position, shape, arrangements and connectivity of an organism's various parts; the pattern underlying its form.

Description: Description of specimen’s disease state (healthy vs diseased tissue)
Ontology Description: A part of an occurrence of a disease process which is associated with position in the normal progression of the disease

Description: ID for the subject organism that this specimen came from
Ontology Description: A material entity that is an individual living system, such as animal, plant, bacteria or virus, that is capable of replicating or reproducing, growth and maintenance in the right environment. An organism may be unicellular or made up, like humans, of many billions of cells divided into specialized tissues and organs.

Description: Age of organism at the time of initial specimen creation
Ontology Description: A time measurement datum that is the result of measurement of age of an organism

Description: Unit for age measurement (days, months, years..)
Ontology Description: A time measurement datum that is the result of measurement of age of an organism
A time measurement datum that is the result of measurement of age of an organism

Description: Description of organism’s sex phenotype (female, male, etc.)
Ontology Description: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's physical expression of sexual characteristics.

Description: Description of organism’s life cycle state (juvenile, adult, elderly)
Ontology Description: A spatiotemporal region encompassing some part of the life cycle of an organism.

Description: A string describing the genotype of the organism
Ontology Description: a genetic characteristics information that is about the genetic material of an organism and minimally includes information about the genetic background and can in addition contain information about specific alleles, genetic modifications, etc.

Description: Description of organism’s disease state (epilepsy, tumor, etc.)
Ontology Description: A disposition (i) to undergo pathological processes that (ii) exists in an organism because of one or more disorders in that organism.

Description: Modalities of this specimen’s data (ephys, morphology, etc)
Ontology Description: A textual entity that denotes some modality.

Description: Experimental techniques used to acquire these data (patch-seq, etc)
Ontology Description: A textual entity that denotes a technique.
